definition: to emerge/to crop up/a little more than
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: That seems to be a theme that kind of repeats itself every couple of decades.
sentences.chinese: 這種言論似乎每隔20年便會再次冒頭。

sentences.english: And soon the fire began to stop.
The full moon eclipse on August 5 will bring financial talks and actions to a head.
sentences.chinese: 8月5日的滿月食將使財政方面的談話或行動冒頭。

sentences.english: Proper measures were taken as soon as erroneous ideas cropped up.
sentences.chinese: 錯誤思想一冒頭，就及時採取了措施。

sentences.english: But when the tempers start to flare, step back and take a breather.
sentences.chinese: 但當火氣開始冒頭時，退下來歇口氣。
